tn.text: Here the author uses the word "now" to shift to telling a new historical account.
"Nadab, who was the firstborn"
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the priests who were anointed and who were ordained
tn.text: This can be stated in active form AT: "the priests whom Moses anointed and ordained" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate these men's names the say way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:01|3:2]].
The phrase "fell dead" means to suddenly die.   AT: "suddenly died before Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to Yahweh's presence, meaning that Yahweh saw everything that happened. AT: "in Yahweh's presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they offered to him unacceptable fire
tn.text: Here the word "fire" is used to refer to "burning incense." AT: "they burned an incense offering in a way that Yahweh did not approve of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "tribe" refers to the men in the tribe. AT: "Bring the men of the tribe of Levi" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"for." This means to do something for someone else, as a representative for them.
Here the "tribes of Israel" refer to the people of Israel. AT: "help the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they must help the tribes of Israel to carry out the tabernacle service
tn.text: The phrase "carry out" means to "serve."  AT: "they must help the tribes of Israel by serving in the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"work of the tabernacle"
"You" refers to Moses.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have given them entirely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: any foreigner who comes near must be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "you must kill any foreigner who comes near" or "any foreigner who comes near must die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but any foreigner who comes near
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit.  AT: "but any foreigner who comes near the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
"I have chosen the Levites"
Yahweh was commanding Moses to only count the male descendants. AT: "Count the male descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here their "ancestor's houses" means their "ancestor's households." This is a metonym for their "clans." AT: "by their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: following the word of Yahweh, just as he was commanded to do
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are used together to emphasize that he obeyed Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This is a list of the descendants of Levi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here the author speaks of "descending" as if it were "coming." AT: "The clans descending from" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here the author speaks of "descending" as if it were "coming." AT: "descend from Gershon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

"Libnites" and "Shimeites" are the name of clans, named after the head of their family. The "Gershonites" is the name of people who descended from Gershon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: All the males from a month old and older were counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses counted all the males from a month old and older" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"seventy-five hundred" or "seven thousand and five hundred" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the curtains in the courtyard"

tn.ref: the courtyard that surrounds the sanctuary and the altar
tn.text: "that is, the courtyard that surrounds the sanctuary and the altar"
This is a list of clans that descended from Kohath. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate this man's name the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:17|3:17]].
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "Moses counted 8,600 males" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: aged one month old and older
tn.text: "from a month old and older"
These verses give us information about the clans that descended from Kohath. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the holy things that are used in their service
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the holy things which the priests use for service" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a list of clans that descended from Merari. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "Moses counted 6,200 males" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This to the panels that they made by joining together smaller pieces of wood.
These are support beams that give stability to the structure.
A post is a strong piece of wood set upright and used as a support.
The bases held the posts in place.
This means everything used to join the crossbars, posts, and bases together.
Here "their" refers to the "pillars and posts."
These are all items used secure the pillars and posts into place.
Here "his" refers to Aaron
This is the east side of the tabernacle. AT: "on the east side, where the sun rises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: for the fulfillment of the duties
tn.text: The word "fulfilment" is an abstract noun that can be expressed as a verb. AT: "to perform the duties" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "You must kill any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary" or "Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
two thousand men** - "22,000 men" or "22,000 males" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: and the livestock of the Levites
tn.text: This refers to all the Levites' livestock. AT: "you must take all the Levites' livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"all the firstborn sons"
The noun "redemption" can be translated with the verb "redeem." AT: "to redeem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"firstborn sons of Israel"
A shekel is a unit of weight equal to about 11 grams. AT: "about 55 grams of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])

tn.ref: who exceed the number of the Levites
tn.text: This means that there are 273 more firstborn males among the other tribes of the Israelites than there are total number of Levite males.

tn.ref: You must use the shekel of the sanctuary as your standard weight
tn.text: This means that the shekel must weight the same as those in the sanctuary. AT: "You must use the weight of the shekels in the sanctuary as your stand weight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"20 gerahs." A gerah is a unit of weight equal to about .57 kilograms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

tn.ref: the price of redemption that you paid
tn.text: Here the word "price" refers to the shekels that Moses collected. AT: "the money that you collected for their redemption" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The noun "redemption" can be translated with the verb "redeem." AT: "to redeem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
A shekel is 11 grams. AT: "about 15 kilograms of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This refers to the money that Moses collected.
Here "his" refers to Aaron

tn.ref: he was told to do by Yahweh's word, as Yahweh had commanded him
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: he was told to do by Yahweh's word
tn.text: Here "Yahweh's word" refers to Yahweh who spoke to Moses. Also, this can be stated in active form.  AT: "that Yahweh had told him to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
